context: The Finnish word 'huono' is an adjective that means bad, poor, or unpleasant. It can describe quality, health, weather, or even a person’s skills. The word declines based on case and number; the provided dictionary definitions show nominative forms like 'huono' (bad) and 'huonot' (bads), as well as genitive, partitive, illative, etc. It can also be used with infinitives to express feeling bad ('tehdä huonoa').
